Welcome to the GTA Speedrunners' Server! (created and sponsored by Joshimuz, ran by 123robot with assistance from Parik and LotsOfS) This is a revival of a community Racing/Destruction Derby/Minigame server from 2013.
FOR HELP PRESS F9 to bring up the help menu, which explains all the addons. FPS is 30 so that physics are near identical to those in speedruns AND IT WILL NOT BE CHANGED. If you have a map you want added, contact 123robot. REMEMBER, always use ghost mode on, respawn time 1 second, and 1 spawn point for races unless otherwise required. Please use the /rate command to rate maps, low rated maps will be considered for removal.
You can donate to help support the running of the server through StreamLabs (but of course only if you're able) at the following donation link: https://streamlabs.com/123robot
RULES AND GUIDELINES:
Basic guidelines of conduct for the server. We want to make it clear precisely what and will not be tolerated on the server.
1) Don't spam the chat with lots of useless and unnecessary messages. 2) Avoid language intended to shock, offend, or otherwise provoke, particularly hate speech and discriminatory language. 3) Do not harass or insult other players needlessly - we want to maintain a friendly atmosphere.
Consistent rule-breaking can result in anything from a mute to a total ban, so keep that in mind. Just try and act sensibly and you shouldn't have to worry about this. I encourage you to use the /report feature and select 'Player Complaints' for anyone who is breaking these guidelines or causing problems.

GENERAL UPDATES: - Car colors broke entirely in the previous update. This should now be resolved. - Fixed an issue where typing /hide 0 after using /hide 2 would not correctly restore every player's visibility. - The race progress bar & race minimap now use the same algorithm for determining checkpoint order as the race gamemode itself, fixing issues where these would just not show up accurately whatsoever for races that had checkpoints out of order in their map file. - Fix a grammar error in the chat warning for maps with too few spawnpoints.
MAP CREATORS: - You can now change the blip size of your checkpoints by adding a "blipsize" attribute to the checkpoint's node, and setting its value to an integer. - This is recommended for maps where the checkpoints are far away and bigger blips are desired so it's easier to find on the F11 map. For example: "[R] Find Your Way". - Alternatively this is useful for checkpoints that are activated by script instead of hit normally. For example "[R] Pack Mule" has 100 checkpoints used to maintain some sense of logic in the progress bar and player ranking, which manifested themselves in the form of a black up-pointing triangle in the middle of the Los Santos bay. - Setting the blipsize to 0 will make it completely invisible. For reference: The default checkpoint blipsize is 2. The size of player blips and the upcoming checkpoint blip is 1. The size of the chased checkpoint blip in "[R] Pack Mule" is 4. - Keep in mind that this is a change that applies to this server only. Until we work out a way to get this feature approved into the official race gamemode, it is recommended that you continue to keep your scripty checkpoints tidy so your maps will also show up well in other and older versions of the race gamemode.

~~~17/04/2024 Update~~~ At this point, I don't think I even have words to describe the size these updates are getting. To be fair though, there's been a lot of work from the combined efforts of me, S, and Ali_Digitali behind the scenes to smooth out the player experience as much as possible, and the amount of changes is a signifier of how much work we've done to achieve that. So I'm very proud of everyone who is helping make the server better, including the many map creators who have contributed to this update! Strap in - this one will keep you going for a while. Which is good, because I have no idea when the next update will be after this one. So I'm pleased to be able to provide as much content as possible in this update to hopefully last for a while.
